page.title: 01The Poles Area NW of Dornoch
page.content: The main feature is a junction, known as "The Poles", of 4 roads: the A9 N to Golspie and Wick, the A95 to Bonar Bridge and Inverness, the Poles road to Dornoch and the single-track road to Skelbo and Loch Fleet. The Trentham Hotel stands at this junction. To the W is the Harriet Plantation, the highest point (about 140m); the land slopes down, S & E towards Dornoch and the sea. To the East are the Fourpenny and the Duchess-Countess Plantations. All 3 are Forestry Commission conifer plantings. The rest of the ground is farmland with crofts in Birichen and Achvandra to the W & N and bigger very old farms on lower ground at Proncy, Proncy-Croy, Balnapolaig and Pitgrudy (where there is a caravan camp site).
